Domine. ^ Out of the depths I have crie: exaudī vōcem meam; fīant aurēs tuae intendentēs in vōcem dēprecātiōnis meae. ^ Lord
hear my voice; let thy ears be attentive to the voice of my supplication.

1 ^ Dē prōfundīs clāmāvī ad tē: 4 ^ Quia apud tē propitiātiō est. ^ For with thee there is merciful forgiveness.

Domine. ^ Out of the depths I have crie: Domine; sustinuit anima mea in verbō ejus. ^ By reason of thy law
column4: O Lord; my soul hath relied on his word.

1 ^ Dē prōfundīs clāmāvī ad tē: 6 ^ Spērāvit anima mea in Dominō ā custōdiā mātūtīnā usque ad noctem; spēret Isrāēl in Dominō. ^ My soul hath hoped in the Lord from the morning watch even until night; let Israel hope in the Lord.

Domine. ^ Out of the depths I have crie: et cōpiōsa apud eum redemptiō. ^ Because with the Lord there is mercy

1 ^ Dē prōfundīs clāmāvī ad tē: 8 ^ Et ipse redimet Isrāēlem ex omnibus inīquitātibus ejus. ^ And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
